instructions.response_format: Use only the squared paper that was handed out

subproblems.description: Given meta data for pictures P1(100, 100, 59) and P2(200, 200, 120) and query picture Q(220, 240, 20), determine which of P1 and P2 is more similar and explain why.
Mention two additional meta data attributes and their values for P1 and P2.
Explain the term semantic gap for P1 and P2.
Calculate the new weight w1 of an input using the delta rule (previous value 0.3, input value 1, desired output 1, actual output 0, learning rate 0.3).
Explain the term backpropagation for the neuron in part a) and for a convolutional network in general.
Write down the activation map for a given input to a convolutional layer and a corresponding filter (no padding).
Explain the part of the network on the left side in the oval. Why are there 3 sheets or levels?
Define relations representing the given ER schema for a video database in the form tablename(attr1, attr2, ...). Mark primary and foreign keys.
Write down tuples for all relations representing the object 'tiger' in scenes 12 and 25 of the video 'Wild Life'.
Write an SQL query to find scenes (including the time schedule) and the corresponding video name in which a tiger appears.
List examples of video meta data that could be created in a Netflix video database using YOLO (You Only Look Once).
Explain how results of the YOLO algorithm for a Netflix video can be represented and searched for in a Frame Segment tree.
